question_text: Which two statements accurately describe differences between Lightning and USB-C? (Select two)
answer_options: Lightning supports alternate modes like DisplayPort natively
USB-C offers broader compatibility with non-Apple devices
Lightning is standardized by the USB-IF consortium
USB-C supports faster charging and data rates than Lightning
Lightning ports are required on all devices sold in the EU
correct_answer: USB-C offers broader compatibility with non-Apple devices
USB-C supports faster charging and data rates than Lightning
explanation: USB-C is industry-standard, supporting faster speeds and more device types. Lightning is Apple-specific and lacks some modern features.
